result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Lee Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Lee Fisher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Judge to DOC regarding unpaid financial obligations.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Tom Johnson.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the complaint. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant was found guilty.
The Court orders that sentence be withheld, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year, concurrent with any other sentence.
Conditions:  Defendant to pay all costs and fees, shall undergo and complete any counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations, and the defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Appeal rights were provided.
From Judge Kirk to defendant - copy to ADA Isherwood and Atty Johnson - re bond
From Judge Kirk to ADA Veronica Isherwood, Atty Tom Johnson - RE:  copy of letter from defendant asking to have his signature bond revoked.

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present
Defendant present, in custody
Attorney  Thomas W. Johnson, Present
  Plea Not Guilty
  Bond continued.
STC to be set by BR2 - requested date
